# PROMPT — MVP **Inwista** (Replit / Expo — simulated features + product/service modules)

**Role of the model:** Act as **product lead, tech lead, and UI/UX designer** to deliver a **navigable MVP** for **Inwista** with **simulated (mocked) features**, **fluid screen-to-screen navigation**, a **unified design system**, and a **modular architecture by product/service**.
**Do not dump a huge project**: produce **clear architecture + essential components + stubs/mocks + runnable examples** sufficient for a functional prototype on **Replit**.

---

## 1) Goal

* **Responsive/adaptive** app with **automatic light/dark mode** (follows OS theme) and a **manual toggle**.
* **Multiplatform** from a single **Expo** project: **Web (major browsers), Tablets, iOS, and Android** (Expo for Web + simulators/Expo Go).
* **Look & feel:** inspired by the attached BTG-style screens and by **Inwista’s identity/content**: [https://inwista.lovable.app/](https://inwista.lovable.app/)
* **Integration-ready:** define interfaces/adapters so mocks can be replaced by real APIs later.
* **Modularized by product/service** (e.g., **PIX**, **StableCOIN**, **Investments**, **Card**, **FX/Remittances**, **Support**, etc.).

---

## 2) Stack & conventions (Replit-friendly)

* **TypeScript** + **Expo (React Native)** with **Expo Router** (universal navigation) and **Expo for Web**.
* **Design System** with **design tokens** and **NativeWind** (Tailwind for RN/Web).
* **State management:** Zustand (or RTK) per module; simulated persistence (AsyncStorage/LocalStorage).
* **Mocks/APIs:** `msw` for Web and local stubs for mobile; `faker` for data.
* **Accessibility (a11y):** roles/labels, visible focus, AA contrast, keyboard/screen-reader navigation.
* **i18n:** PT-BR as default with structure ready for EN.
* **Replit:** simple scripts (`npm run web`, `npm run ios`, `npm run android`) and auto build (Nixpacks/autodetect).

---

## 3) Sync products & services (from Inwista’s website)

1. **Extract** from [https://inwista.lovable.app/](https://inwista.lovable.app/) the visible **products/services, short descriptions, and CTAs** (basic crawl/HTML parse).
2. Output a **catalog file `catalog/products.json`** like:

```json
[
  {"slug":"pix","name":"PIX","category":"payments","short":"Instant transfers","enabled":true},
  {"slug":"stablecoin","name":"StableCOIN","category":"crypto","short":"BRL↔stable conversion","enabled":true},
  {"slug":"investments","name":"Investments","category":"invest","short":"Applications & returns","enabled":true},
  {"slug":"card","name":"Card","category":"banking","short":"Debit/Credit","enabled":false},
  {"slug":"fx-remittance","name":"FX & Remittances","category":"fx","short":"International send/receive","enabled":false},
  {"slug":"support","name":"Support","category":"help","short":"Help & FAQs","enabled":true}
]
```

3. **Rule:** if the crawler cannot read some item, **keep the module with `enabled:false`** and show **“Coming soon”** in UI.
4. **Dynamic UI:** **Home** reads `products.json` and **renders cards** for `enabled:true` (others appear disabled “Coming soon” with a preview screen).

> Note: do **not invent** products—prefer items present on the site; mark the rest as **Coming soon**.

---

## 4) Screens & flows (simulated)

1. **Onboarding/Welcome** (CTA “Get started”).
2. **Authentication**

   * CPF with mask, password, terms/privacy acceptance (simulated links).
   * **Simulated 2FA** (SMS/email) + **token activation** (as in attached screens).
3. **Home/Summary**

   * “Net worth”, “Total invested”, **catalog cards** (PIX, StableCOIN, Investments, etc.), mocked activity feed.
4. **PIX** — send/receive, QR generation, copy key, limits, **receipt** with share, **history**.
5. **StableCOIN** — balance, **buy/sell/convert** BRL↔stable with mocked rate, spread/fee, wallet and TXs.
6. **Investments** — list (Fixed Income, Funds, Stocks, Crypto), filters, **simulate deposit/redemption**, mocked D+ and returns, statement.
7. **Card** — card status (mock), lock/unlock, limits (if `enabled:true`).
8. **FX/Remittances** — quote and simulate remittances (if `enabled:true`).
9. **Profile/Settings** — theme (Light/Dark/Auto), language, privacy, **simulated** biometrics.
10. **Help/FAQ** — based on site content; **simulated** contact form.
11. **Notifications** — **simulated** in-app push (badge + list).
12. **UX states** — empty, loading, error, success.

**Required end-to-end flows (clickable):**

* **Sign-up/Login → 2FA → Activate token → Home**
* **Home → PIX (Send/Receive) → Receipt → History**
* **Home → StableCOIN (Buy/Sell/Convert) → Wallet**
* **Home → Investments (Detail → Simulate → Confirm) → Statement**
* **Home → Settings → Toggle Theme & Biometrics (simulated)**

## 5) Folder structure (Expo + Router, suited for Replit)

```
inwista-mvp/
  app/                      # Expo Router (universal routes)
    (auth)/login.tsx
    (auth)/two-fa.tsx
    (auth)/token-activate.tsx
    (tabs)/index.tsx        # Home (tabs) → loads products.json and cards
    pix/                    # PIX module routes
    stablecoin/             # StableCOIN module
    investments/            # Investments module
    card/                   # Card module
    fx-remittance/          # FX/Remittances module
    settings/               # Profile/Settings
    support/                # Help/FAQ
  components/               # DS: Button, InputCPF, PasswordField, Card, etc.
  core/
    services/               # interfaces + mocks (PixService, StableCoinService, ...)
    store/                  # Zustand slices per module
    utils/                  # masks, formatters, theme utils
  design/
    tokens.ts               # color/spacing/typography tokens (light/dark)
  public/
    assets/                 # logos/icons
  catalog/
    products.json           # site-driven catalog (see Section 3)
  mocks/
    fixtures/               # fake data
  scripts/
    crawl-inwista.js        # site crawler → products.json (with fallback)
  package.json
  app.json
  tsconfig.json
  README.md
```
